MAMA MAKING HISTORY
-------------------

> **“Working moms get the job done”**
> 
> Sen. Tammy Duckworth (D-IL) on becoming the FIRST Senator to give birth while in office, April 9, 2018

[FLIP For More Firsts](https://twitter.com/SenDuckworth/status/983434525626781696)

card_2.cardText:
Tammy’s Firsts
--------------

In addition to becoming the FIRST Senator to give birth while in office (and 1 of only 10 women in Congress to do so), Duckworth was also the

*   1st **disabled woman** elected to the U.S. House of Representatives
*   1st disabled woman **combat veteran** elected to Congress
*   1st member of Congress born in Thailand

card_3.cardText:
Senator Duckworth
=================

*   Duckworth (50) is an **Iraq War veteran** and **ex-army helicopter pilot – part of first wave of women to fly combat mission in Iraq**
*   In 2004, the Black Hawk helicopter she was piloting in Iraq was struck by a rocket-propelled grenade; **She lost both of her legs**.
*   Purple Heart recipient.

Tammy Duckworth has a problem: How can a senator who needs to vote take time off to care for her newborn?A aI canat technically take maternity leave,a Duckworth said in the latest episode of the Women Rule podcast. aBecause if I take maternity leave, then I wonat be allowed to sponsor legislation or vote during that time period.a

The Illinois Democrat and Iraq War veteran, who is expecting her second child this spring, will be the first sitting senator to give birth in office. She plans to take 12 weeks of paid leave a but sheas working with her partyas leadership and her staff to figure out how she can still take important votes while sheas out.

….

The Senate often has members with medical issues who must spend significant time away from Washington. But a mother with a newborn presents new questions that Senate leaders are confronting for the first time. For instance: aYou are not allowed to bring children onto the floor of the Senate at all,a Duckworth pointed out. aIf I have to vote, and Iam breastfeeding my child, especially during my maternity leave period, what do I do?
